com.nerjal.json.elements

Class JsonComment

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.nerjal.json.elements.JsonElement
      • com.nerjal.json.elements.JsonComment

  • public class JsonComment
extends JsonElement

    Represents a JSON comment, inside a JSON structure. Thus allowing to keep them inside a JSON file despite editing it.

    For functional reasons, they are ignored while iterating through composite elements with basic methods. Although some methods, such as JsonArray.forAll(java.util.function.Consumer<com.nerjal.json.elements.JsonElement>), allow to still get them, and therefore edit them if wished to.
    Author:
    nerjal

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      JsonComment()
      Instantiates a new in-line JsonComment with a null value.
      JsonComment(boolean b)
      Instantiates a new JsonComment with a null value.
      Whether the new comment is block or inline is set by the specified boolean.
      JsonComment(String s)
      Instantiates a new JsonComment with the specified value.
      By default, the comment is inline, unless the specified value has more than one line (s.split('\n'))
      JsonComment(String s, boolean b)
      Sets a new JsonComment with the specified value and specified 'block' property.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      JsonComment getAsJsonComment()
      Gives off the JsonComment of the element.
      Has the same effect as casting the element.
      String getAsString()
      Gives off the String value of the element.
      It is only valid for string valued elements such as JsonString and JsonComment
      CommentParseOptions getParseOptions()
      Returns the comment's stringification options.
      String[] getSplitValue()
      Returns he comment's value, split by line.
      boolean isBlock()
      Returns whether the comment is a block comment.
      boolean isComment() 
      void setBlock(boolean block)
      Sets whether the comment shall be block or not (in-line).
      void setValue(String s)
      Sets the comment value to the specified string.
      If the specified string is multi-line, the comment is set to block.
      String stringify(String indentation, String indentIncrement, com.nerjal.json.elements.JsonStringifyStack stack)
      Returns the JSON String corresponding to this JsonElement, recursively parsing the internal elements if there are, with the according base indentation and level indent incrementation.

      • stringify

        public String stringify(String indentation,
                        String indentIncrement,
                        com.nerjal.json.elements.JsonStringifyStack stack)
        Description copied from class: JsonElement
        Returns the JSON String corresponding to this JsonElement, recursively parsing the internal elements if there are, with the according base indentation and level indent incrementation.
        Parameters:
        indentation - the base indentation at which should be the element, hence the one-lower level of its children
        indentIncrement - the string to increment to the indentation at each indentation level, recursively to the element's children as well as their own, etc.
        stack - The foolproof security check to avoid recursive stringification. Can be null.
        Returns:
        The JSON String corresponding to this element.
